page.title: 13ARMY CADETS ON THE IOW
page.content: My brother,Roger is 15 yrs old.He joined the Army cadets at 13. He has 2 uniforms:combat dress,which he usually wears,and Barrack dress for special occasions.He must do map and compass, skill at arms,(safety precautions), rifle field craft and adventure training.He learns to handle different kinds of rifle.They go to weekend camp,sometimes to Newtown on the island,or on the mainland.The Barracks in Totland playing fields,built a year ago, were paid for by the army and have their own rifle range. Before,the cadets were held at Freshwater parish hall.You go Monday,Friday 7-9:30pm, subs are 10p a night.You have to be 13.Every year they go to annual camp in Devon/Salisbury.Totland cadets are sponsored by Royal Corps of Transport Regiment Army paying for uniforms etc. Nichola Hanley 9 years
